definition: “Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: "The Art of War" is the maximum classic in China Military Science.
sentences.chinese: 《孙子兵法》，是中国兵学的最高经典。

sentences.english: Izurieta based much of his tactical thinking on Sun Tzu’s “Art of War.”
sentences.chinese: 伊苏列塔的战术思维主要以《孙子兵法》为蓝本。

sentences.english: His Art of War has been passed down to this day. Qilu culture has a long history.
sentences.chinese: 《孙子兵法》流传至今，齐鲁文化源远流长。

sentences.english: Sun Tzu The Art of War best represents the ancient military strategy of China.
sentences.chinese: 《孙子兵法》是中国古代军事谋略思想的集大成者。

sentences.english: All of China’s top leaders have read Sun Tzu’s The Art of War.
sentences.chinese: 中国所有的最高领导人都读过《孙子兵法》。

sentences.english: It goes back to Sun Tzu and The Art of War.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至让我想起孙子兵法和战争的艺术。

sentences.english: The Art of War by Sun Tzu was composed on a bamboo slip in the 6th century.
sentences.chinese: 孙子于6世纪将《孙子兵法》编写在竹简上。

sentences.english: "The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting. " -Sun Tzu.
sentences.chinese: 孙子兵法说，“战争的最高艺术是不战而屈人之兵。”

sentences.english: Shi, is a drink praise tsu of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《孙子兵法》是一部饮誉世界的兵学圣典。

sentences.english: It, as well as Military Science of Sun Tzu, is regarded as the great one in military theory.
sentences.chinese: 它与《孙子兵法》可称为军事理论的双璧。

sentences.english: Sunzi Military Strategy can not only be used in the war, but also can serve as guidance for Mining.
sentences.chinese: 《孙子兵法》可用于战争，同样也可指导采矿。

sentences.english: Inthe art of war you should always try to deceive your enemy.
sentences.chinese: 按照孙子兵法，你应该不断地迷惑你的敌人。

definition: art of war/military strategy and tactics
a book on the art of war
“Methods of Sima”, also called “Sima Rangju’s Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sima Rangju 司馬穰苴|司马穰苴[Si1 ma3 Rang2 ju1]
Sun Bin's "The Art of War"
The Thirty-Six Stratagems, a Chinese essay used to illustrate a series of stratagems used in politics, war, and in civil interaction/all the possible schemes and stratagems
Wei Liaozi, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], possibly written by Wei Liao 尉繚|尉缭[Wei4 Liao2] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
“Six Secret Strategic Teachings”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], attributed to Jiang Ziya 姜子牙[Jiang1 Zi3 ya2]
the School of the Military, one of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1] of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
military strategist in ancient China/military commander/soldier
The Book of Lord Shang, Legalist text of the 4th century BC
"Strategies of the Warring States", chronicle of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), possibly written by Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2]
the Book of Dao by Laozi or Lao-Tze, the sacred text of Daoism
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]

Sun Wu, famous general, strategist and Legalist philosopher, contemporary with Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC), author of "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]/also known as Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]

Seven Military Classics of ancient China viz "Six Secret Strategic Teachings" 六韜|六韬[Liu4 tao1], "Methods of Sima" 司馬法|司马法[Si1 ma3 Fa3], "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], "Wuzi" 吳子|吴子[Wu2 zi3], "Wei Liaozi" 尉繚子|尉缭子[Wei4 Liao2 zi5], "Three Strategies of Huang Shigong" 黃石公三略|黄石公三略[Huang2 Shi2 gong1 San1 lu:e4] and "Duke Li of Wei Answering Emperor Taizong of Tang" 唐太宗李衛公問對|唐太宗李卫公问对[Tang2 Tai4 zong1 Li3 Wei4 Gong1 Wen4 dui4]
Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls
